00014 /* For CN58XX, the PCI bus speed is auto-detected. For CN3XXX, the driver
00015    uses the value set here as the bus speed. */
00016 #define OCTEON_PCI_BUS_HZ            133

00020 /*--------------------------CONFIG VALUES------------------------*/
00021 /*
00022     The following variables affect the way the driver data structures 
00023     are generated for Octeon devices.
00024     They can be modified.
00025 */
00026 
00027 /*  Maximum no. of octeon devices that the driver can support. */
00028 #define   MAX_OCTEON_DEVICES           4
00029 
00030 
00031 #define   CN3XXX_MAX_INPUT_QUEUES      4
00032 #define   CN3XXX_MAX_OUTPUT_QUEUES     4
00033 
00034 #define   CN56XX_MAX_INPUT_QUEUES      32
00035 #define   CN56XX_MAX_OUTPUT_QUEUES     32
00036 
00037 #define   CN63XX_MAX_INPUT_QUEUES      32
00038 #define   CN63XX_MAX_OUTPUT_QUEUES     32
00039 
00040 #define   CN66XX_MAX_INPUT_QUEUES      32
00041 #define   CN66XX_MAX_OUTPUT_QUEUES     32
00042 
00043 #define   CN68XX_MAX_INPUT_QUEUES      32
00044 #define   CN68XX_MAX_OUTPUT_QUEUES     32
00045 
00046 
00047 
00048 #define   OCTEON_CONFIG_TYPE_DEFAULT          1
00049 #define   OCTEON_CONFIG_TYPE_CN3XXX_CUSTOM    2
00050 #define   OCTEON_CONFIG_TYPE_CN56XX_CUSTOM    3
00051 #define   OCTEON_CONFIG_TYPE_CN63XX_CUSTOM    4
00052 #define   OCTEON_CONFIG_TYPE_CN66XX_CUSTOM    5
00053 #define   OCTEON_CONFIG_TYPE_CN68XX_CUSTOM    6

00056 
00057 /** Structure for global configuration attributes that are common across
00058     all Octeon processors. */
00059 typedef struct {
00060 
00061     /** Number of Input queues (usually 4). */
00062     uint16_t   num_iqs;
00063 
00064     /** Number of Output queues (usually 4) */
00065     uint16_t   num_oqs;
00066 
00067     /** Pending list size (usually set to the sum of the size of all Input
00068         queues) */
00069     uint32_t   pending_list_size;
00070 
00071 } octeon_common_config_t;
00072 
00073 
00074 
00075 
00076 /** Structure to define the configuration attributes for each Input queue.
00077     Applicable to all Octeon processors */
00078 typedef struct {
00079 
00080     /** Size of the Input queue (number of commands) */
00081     uint32_t   num_descs;
00082 
00083     /** Command size - 32 or 64 bytes */
00084     uint32_t   instr_type;
00085 
00086     /** Minimum number of commands pending to be posted to Octeon before driver
00087         hits the Input queue doorbell. */
00088     uint32_t   db_min;
00089 
00090     /** Minimum ticks to wait before checking for pending instructions. */
00091     uint32_t   db_timeout;
00092 
00093 } octeon_iq_config_t;
00094 
00095 
00096 
00097 
00098 
00099 
00100 
00101 
00102 
00103 /** Structure to define configuration attributes for each Output queue
00104     in the CN38XX/CN58XX Octeon processors. */
00105 typedef struct {
00106 
00107     /** Size of Output queue (number of descriptors) */
00108     uint32_t   num_descs;
00109 
00110     /** Size of buffer in this Output queue. */
00111     uint32_t   buf_size;
00112 
00113     /** If set, the Output queue uses info-pointer mode. (Default: 1 ) */
00114     uint32_t   info_ptr;
00115 
00116     /** Number of packets to be processed by driver tasklet every invocation
00117         for this Output queue. */
00118     uint32_t   pkts_per_intr;
00119 
00120     /** Interrupt Coalescing (Packet Count). Octeon will interrupt the host
00121         only if it sent as many packets as specified by this field. The driver
00122         usually does not use packet count interrupt coalescing. */
00123     uint32_t   intr_pkt;
00124 
00125     /** Interrupt Coalescing (Time Interval). Octeon will interrupt the host
00126         if atleast one packet was sent in the time interval specified by this
00127         field. The driver uses time interval interrupt coalescing by default.
00128         The time is specified in microseconds. */
00129     uint32_t   intr_time;
00130 
00131     /** The number of buffers that were consumed during packet processing by
00132         the driver on this Output queue before the driver attempts to replenish
00133         the descriptor ring with new buffers. */
00134     uint32_t   refill_threshold;
00135 
00136 } cn3xxx_oq_config_t;
00137 
00138 
00139 
00140 
00141 
00142 /** Structure to define configuration attributes for each Output queue
00143     in the CN56XX Octeon processors. */
00144 typedef struct {
00145 
00146     /** Size of Output queue (number of descriptors) */
00147     uint32_t   num_descs;
00148 
00149     /** If set, the Output queue uses info-pointer mode. (Default: 1 ) */
00150     uint32_t   info_ptr;
00151 
00152     /** Number of packets to be processed by driver tasklet every invocation
00153         for this Output queue. */
00154     uint32_t   pkts_per_intr;
00155 
00156     /** The number of buffers that were consumed during packet processing by
00157         the driver on this Output queue before the driver attempts to replenish
00158         the descriptor ring with new buffers. */
00159     uint32_t   refill_threshold;
00160 
00161 } cn56xx_oq_config_t;
00162 
00163 
00164 
00165 /** Structure to define configuration attributes for each Output queue
00166     in the CN63XX & CN68XX Octeon processors. */
00167 struct cn6xxx_oq_config {
00168 
00169     /** Size of Output queue (number of descriptors) */
00170     uint32_t   num_descs;
00171 
00172     /** If set, the Output queue uses info-pointer mode. (Default: 1 ) */
00173     uint32_t   info_ptr;
00174 
00175     /** Output queue buffer size */
00176     uint32_t   buf_size;
00177 
00178     /** Number of packets to be processed by driver tasklet every invocation
00179         for this Output queue. */
00180     uint32_t   pkts_per_intr;
00181 
00182     /** The number of buffers that were consumed during packet processing by
00183         the driver on this Output queue before the driver attempts to replenish
00184         the descriptor ring with new buffers. */
00185     uint32_t   refill_threshold;
00186 
00187 } ;

00190 typedef struct cn6xxx_oq_config    cn63xx_oq_config_t;
00191 typedef struct cn6xxx_oq_config    cn66xx_oq_config_t;
00192 typedef struct cn6xxx_oq_config    cn68xx_oq_config_t;

00198 /** Structure to define the configuration for CN38XX/CN58XX Octeon processors.*/
00199 typedef  struct {
00200 
00201     /** Common attributes. */
00202     octeon_common_config_t   c;
00203 
00204     /** Input Queue attributes. */
00205     octeon_iq_config_t       iq[CN3XXX_MAX_INPUT_QUEUES];
00206 
00207     /** Output Queue attributes. */
00208     cn3xxx_oq_config_t       oq[CN3XXX_MAX_OUTPUT_QUEUES];
00209 
00210 } cn3xxx_config_t;
00211 
00212 
00213 
00214 
00215 
00216 
00217 /** Structure to define the configuration for CN56XX Octeon processors. */
00218 typedef  struct {
00219 
00220     /** Common attributes. */
00221     octeon_common_config_t  c;
00222 
00223     /** Input Queue attributes. */
00224     octeon_iq_config_t      iq[CN56XX_MAX_INPUT_QUEUES];
00225 
00226     /** Some of the Output Queue attributes. */
00227     cn56xx_oq_config_t      oq[CN56XX_MAX_OUTPUT_QUEUES];
00228 
00229     /** Output queue buffer size (All Output queue buffers are of same size). */
00230     uint32_t                oq_buf_size;
00231 
00232     /** Interrupt Coalescing (Packet Count). Octeon will interrupt the host
00233         only if it sent as many packets as specified by this field. The driver
00234         usually does not use packet count interrupt coalescing. 
00235         All output queues have the same packet count setting. */
00236     uint32_t                oq_intr_pkt;
00237 
00238     /** Interrupt Coalescing (Time Interval). Octeon will interrupt the host
00239         if atleast one packet was sent in the time interval specified by this
00240         field. The driver uses time interval interrupt coalescing by default.
00241         The time is specified in microseconds.
00242         All output queues have the same time interval setting. */
00243     uint32_t                oq_intr_time;
00244 
00245 #ifdef CVMCS_DMA_IC
00246         /** Interrupt Coalescing (Packet Count). Octeon will interrupt the host
00247          *  only if it DMAed as many packets as specified by this field. */
00248         uint32_t                dma_intr_pkt;
00249 
00250         /** Interrupt Coalescing (Time Interval). Octeon will interrupt the host
00251          *  if atleast one packet was DMAed in the time interval specified by 
00252          *  this field. */
00253         uint32_t                dma_intr_time;
00254 #endif
00255 
00256 } cn56xx_config_t;
00257 
00258 
00259 
00260 
00261 /** Structure to define the configuration for CN63XX Octeon processors. */
00262 typedef  struct {
00263 
00264     /** Common attributes. */
00265     octeon_common_config_t  c;
00266 
00267     /** Input Queue attributes. */
00268     octeon_iq_config_t      iq[CN63XX_MAX_INPUT_QUEUES];
00269 
00270     /** Some of the Output Queue attributes. */
00271     cn63xx_oq_config_t      oq[CN63XX_MAX_OUTPUT_QUEUES];
00272 
00273     /** Interrupt Coalescing (Packet Count). Octeon will interrupt the host
00274         only if it sent as many packets as specified by this field. The driver
00275         usually does not use packet count interrupt coalescing. 
00276         All output queues have the same packet count setting. */
00277     uint32_t                oq_intr_pkt;
00278 
00279     /** Interrupt Coalescing (Time Interval). Octeon will interrupt the host
00280         if atleast one packet was sent in the time interval specified by this
00281         field. The driver uses time interval interrupt coalescing by default.
00282         The time is specified in microseconds.
00283         All output queues have the same time interval setting. */
00284     uint32_t                oq_intr_time;
00285 
00286 #ifdef CVMCS_DMA_IC
00287     /** Interrupt Coalescing (Packet Count). Octeon will interrupt the host
00288         only if it DMAed as many packets as specified by this field. */
00289     uint32_t                dma_intr_pkt;
00290 
00291     /** Interrupt Coalescing (Time Interval). Octeon will interrupt the host
00292         if atleast one packet was DMAed in the time interval specified by this
00293         field. */ 
00294     uint32_t                dma_intr_time;
00295 #endif
00296 
00297 } cn63xx_config_t;

00303 /** Structure to define the configuration for CN66XX Octeon processors. */
00304 typedef  struct {
00305 
00306     /** Common attributes. */
00307     octeon_common_config_t  c;
00308 
00309     /** Input Queue attributes. */
00310     octeon_iq_config_t      iq[CN66XX_MAX_INPUT_QUEUES];
00311 
00312     /** Some of the Output Queue attributes. */
00313     cn66xx_oq_config_t      oq[CN66XX_MAX_OUTPUT_QUEUES];
00314 
00315     /** Interrupt Coalescing (Packet Count). Octeon will interrupt the host
00316         only if it sent as many packets as specified by this field. The driver
00317         usually does not use packet count interrupt coalescing. 
00318         All output queues have the same packet count setting. */
00319     uint32_t                oq_intr_pkt;
00320 
00321     /** Interrupt Coalescing (Time Interval). Octeon will interrupt the host
00322         if atleast one packet was sent in the time interval specified by this
00323         field. The driver uses time interval interrupt coalescing by default.
00324         The time is specified in microseconds.
00325         All output queues have the same time interval setting. */
00326     uint32_t                oq_intr_time;
00327 
00328 #ifdef CVMCS_DMA_IC
00329     /** Interrupt Coalescing (Packet Count). Octeon will interrupt the host
00330         only if it DMAed as many packets as specified by this field. */
00331     uint32_t                dma_intr_pkt;
00332 
00333     /** Interrupt Coalescing (Time Interval). Octeon will interrupt the host
00334         if atleast one packet was DMAed in the time interval specified by this
00335         field. */ 
00336     uint32_t                dma_intr_time;
00337 #endif
00338 
00339 } cn66xx_config_t;

00345 /** Structure to define the configuration for CN68XX Octeon processors. */
00346 typedef  struct {
00347 
00348     /** Common attributes. */
00349     octeon_common_config_t  c;
00350 
00351     /** Input Queue attributes. */
00352     octeon_iq_config_t      iq[CN68XX_MAX_INPUT_QUEUES];
00353 
00354     /** Some of the Output Queue attributes. */
00355     cn68xx_oq_config_t      oq[CN68XX_MAX_OUTPUT_QUEUES];
00356 
00357     /** Interrupt Coalescing (Packet Count). Octeon will interrupt the host
00358         only if it sent as many packets as specified by this field. The driver
00359         usually does not use packet count interrupt coalescing. 
00360         All output queues have the same packet count setting. */
00361     uint32_t                oq_intr_pkt;
00362 
00363     /** Interrupt Coalescing (Time Interval). Octeon will interrupt the host
00364         if atleast one packet was sent in the time interval specified by this
00365         field. The driver uses time interval interrupt coalescing by default.
00366         The time is specified in microseconds.
00367         All output queues have the same time interval setting. */
00368     uint32_t                oq_intr_time;
00369 
00370 #ifdef CVMCS_DMA_IC
00371     /** Interrupt Coalescing (Packet Count). Octeon will interrupt the host
00372         only if it DMAed as many packets as specified by this field. */
00373     uint32_t                dma_intr_pkt;
00374 
00375     /** Interrupt Coalescing (Time Interval). Octeon will interrupt the host
00376         if atleast one packet was DMAed in the time interval specified by this
00377         field. */ 
00378     uint32_t                dma_intr_time;
00379 #endif

00381 } cn68xx_config_t;

00387 /* Maximum number of ordered requests to check for completion. */
00388 #define OCTEON_MAX_ORDERED_COMPLETION  16
00389 
00390 
00391 
00392 
00393 
00394 /* 
00395    The following config values are fixed and should not be modified.
00396 */
00397 
00398 /* Maximum address space to be mapped for Octeon's BAR1 index-based access. */
00399 #define  MAX_BAR1_MAP_INDEX        2
00400 #define  OCTEON_BAR1_ENTRY_SIZE   (4 * 1024 * 1024)
00401 
00402 /* BAR1 Index 0 to (MAX_BAR1_MAP_INDEX - 1) for normal mapped memory access.
00403    Bar1 register at MAX_BAR1_MAP_INDEX used by driver for dynamic access. */
00404 #define  MAX_BAR1_IOREMAP_SIZE    ((MAX_BAR1_MAP_INDEX + 1) * OCTEON_BAR1_ENTRY_SIZE)
00405 
00406 
00407 
00408 
00409 /* Response lists - 1 ordered, 1 unordered-blocking, 1 unordered-nonblocking */
00410 /* NoResponse Lists are now maintained with each IQ. (Dec' 2007). */
00411 #define MAX_RESPONSE_LISTS           3
00412 
00413 /* Number of buffer pools - always fixed at 6. */
00414 #define BUF_POOLS                    6
00415 
00416 /*-------------- Dispatch function lookup table -----------*/
00417 /* Opcode hash bits. The opcode is hashed on the lower 6-bits to lookup the
00418    dispatch table. */
00419 #define OPCODE_MASK_BITS             6
00420 
00421 /* Mask for the 6-bit lookup hash */
00422 #define OCTEON_OPCODE_MASK           0x3f
00423 
00424 /* Size of the dispatch table. The 6-bit hash can index into 2^6 entries */
00425 #define DISPATCH_LIST_SIZE           (1 << OPCODE_MASK_BITS) 
00426 
00427 
00428 
00429 
00430 /*----------- The buffer pool -------------------*/
00431 
00432 
00433 /* Number of  32k buffers. */
00434 #define HUGE_BUFFER_CHUNKS              32
00435 
00436 /* Number of  16k buffers. */
00437 #define LARGE_BUFFER_CHUNKS             64
00438 
00439 /* Number of  8k buffers. */
00440 #define MEDIUM_BUFFER_CHUNKS            64
00441 
00442 /* Number of  4k buffers. */
00443 #define SMALL_BUFFER_CHUNKS             128
00444 
00445 /* Number of  2k buffers. */
00446 #define TINY_BUFFER_CHUNKS              512
00447 
00448 /* Number of  1k buffers. */
00449 #define EX_TINY_BUFFER_CHUNKS           1024
00450 
00451 
00452 
00453 #define HUGE_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE          (32*1024)
00454 
00455 #define LARGE_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE         (16*1024)
00456 
00457 #define MEDIUM_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE        (8*1024)
00458 
00459 #define SMALL_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE         (4*1024)
00460 
00461 #define TINY_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE          (2*1024)
00462 
00463 #define EX_TINY_BUFFER_CHUNK_SIZE       (1*1024)
00464 
00465 #define  MAX_FRAGMENTS                  32
00466 
00467 #define  MAX_BUFFER_CHUNKS              1500
00468 
00469 
00470 /* Maximum number of Octeon Instruction (command) queues */
00471 #define     MAX_OCTEON_INSTR_QUEUES         CN56XX_MAX_INPUT_QUEUES
00472 
00473 /* Maximum number of Octeon Instruction (command) queues */
00474 #define     MAX_OCTEON_OUTPUT_QUEUES        CN56XX_MAX_OUTPUT_QUEUES
00475 
00476 
00477 /* Maximum number of DMA software output queues per Octeon device. 
00478    Though CN56XX supports 5 DMA engines, only the first 2 can generate
00479    interrupts on the host. So we stick with 2 for the time being. */
00480 #define     MAX_OCTEON_DMA_QUEUES           2
